document_title: Peripheral neuropathy: Causes, symptoms and treatments
subsection_content:
Treatment is based on treating the underlying disorder. For example, if diabetes is the cause, good blood sugar control is needed. If a vitamin deficiency is the cause, it can be treated by supplementing the missing vitamins... Many treatments can help relieve symptoms and return the person to daily activities. Sometimes, combining treatment methods can provide the best treatment results.
Pain relievers: Over-the-counter (OTC) pain relievers such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs such as aspirin and ibuprofen can help control moderate pain. But if the patient takes too much, these drugs can negatively affect liver or stomach function. Therefore, patients need to use it as directed and should not use it for a long time, especially for those who often drink alcohol.; Pain relievers: Over-the-counter (OTC) pain relievers such as acetaminophen (Tylenol) and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs such as aspirin and ibuprofen can help control moderate pain. But if the patient takes too much, these drugs can negatively affect liver or stomach function. Therefore, patients need to use it as directed and should not use it for a long time, especially for those who often drink alcohol.
Prescription medications: Many prescription pain medications can also help control pain caused by peripheral neuropathy, such as some anti-seizure medications and some antidepressants. Additionally, other prescription medications include: Cyclooxygenase-2 inhibitors; tramadol; corticosteroid injections; seizure medication such as gabapentin or pregabalin; antidepressants such as amitriptyline; Cymbalta (a serotonin norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor); Prescription medications for sexual dysfunction in men include: sildenafil (Viagra); vardenafil (Levitra, Staxyn); tadalafil (Cialis); avanafil (Stendra).; Prescription medications: Many prescription pain medications can also help control pain caused by peripheral neuropathy, such as some anti-seizure medications and some antidepressants. Additionally, other prescription medications include: Cyclooxygenase-2 inhibitors; tramadol; corticosteroid injections; seizure medication such as gabapentin or pregabalin; antidepressants such as amitriptyline; Cymbalta (a serotonin norepinephrine reuptake inhibitor); Prescription medications for sexual dysfunction in men include: sildenafil (Viagra); vardenafil (Levitra, Staxyn); tadalafil (Cialis); avanafil (Stendra).
Plasmapheresis: This is a medical treatment to control the symptoms of peripheral neuropathy. This transfusion method helps remove potentially irritating antibodies from the blood. If the patient has a nerve block, the doctor will inject anesthetic directly into the nerve to treat the disease.; Plasmapheresis: This is a medical treatment to control the symptoms of peripheral neuropathy. This transfusion method helps remove potentially irritating antibodies from the blood. If the patient has a nerve block, the doctor will inject anesthetic directly into the nerve to treat the disease.
Transcutaneous electronic nerve stimulation (TENS): During TENS, electrodes placed on the skin transmit a small amount of electricity into the skin. The goal of this treatment is to interrupt the nerves that transmit pain signals to the brain.; Transcutaneous electronic nerve stimulation (TENS): During TENS, electrodes placed on the skin transmit a small amount of electricity into the skin. The goal of this treatment is to interrupt the nerves that transmit pain signals to the brain.
Cast or splint: this method can help improve peripheral neuropathy in the legs and arms.; Casting or splinting: this method can help improve peripheral neuropathy in the legs and arms.
Other treatment support methods: In addition, patients can apply a number of methods to help reduce symptoms of peripheral neuropathy such as: Chiropractic care; Acupuncture; Massage; meditation; yoga or regular, gentle exercise; Other treatment support methods: In addition, patients can apply a number of methods to help reduce symptoms of peripheral neuropathy such as: Chiropractic care; Acupuncture; Massage; meditation; yoga or regular, gentle exercise.
Surgical methods: In peripheral neuropathy surgery, depending on the specific case, there are methods: Decompressing surrounding organizations that cause nerve compression, thereby helping to reduce pain and improve sensation. Connecting, grafting and transferring nerves: in nerve plexus damage helps restore arm nerves to improve arm activities, minimal activities in daily activities; Surgical methods: In peripheral neuropathy surgery, depending on the specific case, there are methods: Decompressing surrounding organizations that cause nerve compression, thereby helping to reduce pain and improve sensation. Connecting, grafting and transferring nerves: in nerve plexus damage helps restore arm nerves to improve arm activities, minimal activities in daily activities; Decompression of surrounding organizations causing nerve compression, thereby helping to reduce pain and improve sensation.; Connecting, grafting and transferring nerves: in nerve plexus injuries helps restore arm nerves to improve arm activities, minimal activities in daily activities
Doctor Vo Don noted that patients should quit alcohol and cigarettes (if currently using). Both alcohol and tobacco worsen peripheral neuropathy and can cause nerve damage with long-term use. At the same time, patients need to pay attention to staying safe to avoid accidents due to loss of balance or loss of sensation caused by peripheral neuropathy such as:
Do not go barefoot; There are no obstacles in the house; Check the temperature of the bathtub or dishwater with your elbow, not your hand or foot.; Install handrails in the bathtub or shower.; Use anti-slip bath mats.; Do not stay in one position for too long. Instead, the patient should stand up and walk around a few times every hour.
Over-the-counter pain relievers such as acetaminophen can help control moderate pain caused by peripheral neuropathy.
